channel.title: NPR Topics: Culture
channel.description: Art and entertainment commentary plus interviews, book reviews, movie reviews, music reviews, comedy, and visual art. Subscribe to podcasts and follow trends in music, painting, art, architecture, photography, and design.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Bowen Yang leaves 'SNL' midway through his 8th season
item.description: The comedian is scheduled to co-host his final show on Saturday with Wicked star Ariana Grande.
item.content:encoded:
The comedian is scheduled to co-host his final show on Saturday with Wicked star Ariana Grande.

(Image credit: Jamie McCarthy)
item.dc:creator: Chloe Veltman

item.title: Is 'Die Hard' a Christmas movie?
item.description: It's a perennial holiday debate: Is "Die Hard" a Christmas movie? A Philadelphia theater group offers a live reading of the 1988 action classic just in time for the holidays.
item.content:encoded: It's a perennial holiday debate: Is "Die Hard" a Christmas movie? A Philadelphia theater group offers a live reading of the 1988 action classic just in time for the holidays.
item.dc:creator: Buffy Gorrilla

item.title: A look at the musical 'Two Strangers (Carry a Cake Across New York)'
item.description: A new, two-person musical is a romantic comedy for our generation.
item.content:encoded: A new, two-person musical is a romantic comedy for our generation.
item.dc:creator: Jeff Lunden

item.title: It was called the Kennedy Center, but 3 different presidents shaped it
item.description: Washington, D.C.'s performing arts center was named for President Kennedy after his assassination. But his vision for the arts as a cornerstone of democracy was shared by Eisenhower and Johnson.
item.content:encoded:
Washington, D.C.'s performing arts center was named for President Kennedy after his assassination. But his vision for the arts as a cornerstone of democracy was shared by Eisenhower and Johnson.

(Image credit: National Archives)
item.dc:creator: Anastasia Tsioulcas

item.title: Cheddar bay biscuits, cheap margs and memories: Readers share their nostalgia for chain restaurants
item.description: Americans have deep nostalgia, and love, for America's chain restaurants. Why? We asked and more than 150 readers answered.
item.content:encoded: Americans have deep nostalgia, and love, for America's chain restaurants. Why? We asked and more than 150 readers answered.
item.dc:creator: Jaclyn Diaz

item.title: We caught up with one of the kids who sang on 'A Charlie Brown Christmas.' He's 72 now
item.description: Dave Willat was just 11 years old when he showed up for what he thought would be a routine church choir practice in 1965. He and his fellow singers ended up making history.
item.content:encoded:
Dave Willat was just 11 years old when he showed up for what he thought would be a routine church choir practice in 1965. He and his fellow singers ended up making history.

(Image credit: Apple)
item.dc:creator: Chloe Veltman

item.title: Meet the new WaPo food critic who won't dine in anonymity
item.description: NPR's Leila Fadel tags along for lunch with Elazar Sontag, the Washington Post's new food critic.
item.content:encoded:
Morning Edition about ending anonymity and rethinking how restaurant criticism can feel more accessible.'/>

NPR's Leila Fadel tags along for lunch with Elazar Sontag, the Washington Post's new food critic.
item.dc:creator: Leila Fadel

item.title: After John le Carré's death, his son faced the 'daunting' task of reviving George Smiley
item.description: Nick Harkaway grew up hearing his dad read drafts of his George Smiley novels. He picked up le Carré's beloved spymaster character in the novel Karla's Choice. Originally broadcast Oct. 23, 2024.
item.content:encoded: Nick Harkaway grew up hearing his dad read drafts of his George Smiley novels. He picked up le Carré's beloved spymaster character in the novel Karla's Choice. Originally broadcast Oct. 23, 2024.
item.dc:creator: Sam Briger

item.title: Comedian Kumail Nanjiani on the experience he wishes he could give every person
item.description: On Wild Card, well-known guests answer the kinds of questions we often think about but don't talk about. Comedian Kumail Nanjiani talks about the experience he wishes he could give every person.
item.content:encoded: On Wild Card, well-known guests answer the kinds of questions we often think about but don't talk about. Comedian Kumail Nanjiani talks about the experience he wishes he could give every person.

item.title: Rob Reiner loved America. He thought it could be better
item.description: NPR's Scott Detrow speaks with writer Todd S. Purdum about his last interview with Rob Reiner and the filmmaker's legacy as an advocate.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Scott Detrow speaks with writer Todd S. Purdum about his last interview with Rob Reiner and the filmmaker's legacy as an advocate.
item.dc:creator: Elena Burnett
